page.title: 06Walberton_New Village Hall
page.content: The subject uppermost in village life this year is the provision of a new village hall to replace the last one, condemned and demolished because of dry rot. It was decided at a general meeting two years ago to raise funds to build another hall designed to meet the needs of the village. The likely total cost is expected to be about Â£140,000, a large part of which should be available through grants. Progress to date is that a design is soon to be selected, a site on the playing field has been chosen, and over Â£23,000 has been raised. About Â£40,000 is needed for work to commence. Fund raising has included two fetes with Donkey Derbys, coffee mornings, concerts, Harvest suppers, various sales, 7 sponsored marathon runners, donations, dogshow, etc.
